subject: Sexual Health
title: Perfect Use vs Typical Use
description: A micro-lesson that makes Perfect Use vs Typical Use usable.

hook.text: Every contraceptive has two effectiveness rates: how well it works in theory and how well it works in real life.

buildup.text: Perfect use means following every instruction flawlessly. Typical use reflects how people actually behave.

discovery.text: The pill is 99% effective with perfect use but only 91% with typical use because people miss doses.

twist.text: Methods requiring less user action, like IUDs and implants, have nearly identical perfect and typical rates.

climax.text: Choosing a method that matches your lifestyle matters more than choosing the one with the best lab numbers.

punchline.text: The best method is the one you actually use right.

quiz.question: Why do IUDs have similar perfect and typical use rates?
